dt: {bc}to have previous knowledge of {bc}know beforehand especially by paranormal means or by revelation

pt: {sc}foresee{/sc} {sc}foreknow{/sc} {sc}divine{/sc} {sc}anticipate{/sc} mean to know beforehand. {sc}foresee{/sc} implies nothing about how the knowledge is derived and may apply to ordinary reasoning and experience.
{sc}foreknow{/sc} usually implies supernatural assistance, as through revelation.

pt.t: if only we could {it}foreknow{/it} our own destinies

pt: {sc}divine{/sc} adds to {sc}foresee{/sc} the suggestion of exceptional wisdom or discernment.

pt.t: was able to {it}divine{/it} Europe's rapid recovery from the war

pt: {sc}anticipate{/sc} implies taking action about or responding emotionally to something before it happens.

shortdef: to have previous knowledge of : know beforehand especially by paranormal means or by revelation
